experience: You and Jeffrey both know Allan Dunn, Virgil Coxon, and 4 others
You both studied at Northern Arizona University
Jeffrey studied at Northern Arizona University before you started

•	Work on the ITG GIS Team to provide support for ArcGIS applications including maintaining Esri ArcGIS servers and geodatabases (SQL Server and file based).•	Develop/modify/troubleshoot applications using C#, ASP.NET, ArcGIS, Python, Javascript, DOJO, HTML, SQL Server, and Visual Studio (and MS TFS for change management)•	Work with business areas to determine GIS needs and priorities for completion•	Design, document, and maintain information on existing and proposed GIS architectures•	Develop and maintain consistent GIS standards and practices and ensure Agency security practices are followed•	Administrate the Planview Project Management application and train users on its use

•	Developed web based mapping applications using VB.Net, ASP.Net, VB, C#, ASP, ArcIMS, Javascript, DHTML, and HTML•	Performed GIS needs assessment and implementation planning•	Provided GIS mapping and analysis support for planners and project managers•	Determined project GIS requirements and deliverables, and produce and manage their completion

•	Supervised 3 GIS analysts and 1 GIS Programmer•	Developed GIS console and web applications using VB.Net, ASP.Net, VB, ASP, ArcIMS, Map Objects, Avenue, Javascript, DHTML, and HTML (NAS Fallon, MCAS Camp Pendleton, MCLB Barstow, Pennsylvania State University)
Developed GIS application or addressing using Visual Basic, ORACLE, MapObjects and ArcSDE.

Developed, tested, and implemented ArcView AVENUE/Visual Basic applicationsCoordinated GIS efforts for the P&D DepartmentCreated & maintained ArcView databasesDeveloped output graphics & analysisRepresented P&D Department in County GIS meetings

Primarily rural geography studies for my Masters, with a focus on using GIS.  I was the lab teacher for 2 semesters of the GIS class (taught by Dr. Margaret Moore) and my master's thesis used GIS to model solar radiation on 3 dimensional surfaces.

Applied Geography, Emphasis Land Use Planning, Minor Remote Sensing

Primarily geography classes with an emphasis on Land Use Planning.  My remote sensing minor was an in depth study of the different types of products available from the different platforms, and how to use those products in the field.

Nader H. Attar, PE, MBA
President at Insight Energy Solutions
March 7, 2016, Jeffrey reported directly to Nader H.

Nader was a personal mentor to me during my early career in GIS, and I learned a lot about GIS implementation strategy from him.  He is able to see through the somewhat constrictive politics of an agency to get to the heart of what needs to be done and when.  Plus, he always found a way to make the job interesting, rewarding, and fun.  I would recommend him for any management position.

David Ward, GISP
Associate Vice President of Infrastructure Planning and Management
August 17, 2015, Jeffrey worked with David but at different companies

David Ward is the most knowledgeable person about Linear Referencing System (LRS) technology of anyone I know.  His ability to understand the information at a technical level as well as modify it at a less technical level is the cohesive link to keep everyone talking about the same thing.  He is also very knowledgeable about GIS, specifically Esri products including their new LRS, Roads & Highways (R&H) as he helped ADOT through their implementation process.  David’s efforts are the primary reason we were able to implement R&H in a relatively short time and he continues to help us out when we have questions or concerns.  A consummate professional with a wealth of knowledge, while still remaining very approachable, he will be a benefit on any project you can come up with.

Jennifer Berthiaume, GISP
GIS Analyst at ARCADIS U.S., Inc.
June 25, 2015, Jeffrey was a client of Jennifer’s

Jennifer is the constant professional who's prowess at designing, using, and demonstrating all aspects of GIS are not only widely regarded as exceptional, but quickly come to be relied upon by client and peer in order to get things done, and to get them done right.  After I have been involved with multiple projects working with Jennifer I don't know how they would have been completed correctly, on-time, and under budget without her.

summary: Reliable, creative, efficient, and dedicated to achieving the most integrated, useful, and accessible GIS resources at every agency that I work for.  My objective is to bring GIS functionality to the masses while still respecting the need for accurate and timely information.
